Class Tile

  • java.lang.Object
    • Tile

  • public class Tile
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the tiles on the game board. Tiles can be shared or private (represented ba isPrivate) (see Readme) Rather than create their own private tiles for each player they share the same tile and can each have on token on them. On shared tiles there can only be 1 token. Tiles can also be double roll tiles (represented by rollAgain). The shared double roll tile is a safespot.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int id
      Tile id (used to identify a tile and it's position on the board)
      private boolean isPrivate
      Shows if this tile is a private tile
      private boolean rollAgain
      Shows if this tile is a double roll tile
      private java.util.ArrayList<Token> tokens
      List of tokens on this tile (max 2 if private tile, 1 if shared tile

            boolean isPrivate,

        Constructor
        Parameters:
        id - Token ID
        isPrivate - Is a private tile (IDs 0-3 and 12-13)

        public boolean isOccupiedByOwn(int playerId)
        This method checks if other own token is already on this tile
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if own token occupies this tile, false otherwise

        Checks if another players token is already on this tile
        Parameters:
        playerId - player whos token it is (not Opponent!!!)
        Returns:
        true if opponents token occupies this tile, false otherwise
